availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Edward W. Phillips (Marion County, Kentucky, student, laborer, and farmer)

body.p: Marion County, Kentucky, student, laborer, and farmer. Kentucky native. Son of Felix George Phillips and Frances “Fannie” Penick Phillips. Student in Marion County, Kentucky, in 1850. Household owned seven enslaved persons in 1850. Laborer in Marion County, Kentucky, in 1860. Household owned eight enslaved persons in Marion County in 1860. Farmer in Marion County in 1863.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Marion County, District 2, p. 399B.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Marion County, p. 666.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Marion County, District 2, p. 657-658.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Marion County, District 2, p. 491A.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Marion County, Lebanon, p. 49B.
Tennessee Death Records, 1908-1958, Tennessee State Library and Archives, Nashville, TN, Knox County Death Certificates, File #24423.
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records, Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War), NARA RG 110, Marion County, KY, 1863, p. 386.
"Edward W. Phillips (1840-1872)," Find A Grave, Memorial #112675149, accessed December 20, 2021, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/112675149.
